properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: origin
properties.description: (Required) The fully qualified domain name, (FQDN) for a Space.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The time to live for the CDN Endpoint, in seconds. Default is 3600 seconds.

properties.name: certificate_id
properties.description: - (Optional) The ID of a DigitalOcean managed TLS certificate used for SSL when a custom subdomain is provided.

properties.name: custom_domain
properties.description: (Optional) The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the custom subdomain used with the CDN Endpoint.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the certificate for identification.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) The type of certificate to provision. Can be either custom or lets_encrypt. Defaults to custom.

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: (Optional) The contents of a PEM-formatted private-key corresponding to the SSL certificate. Only valid when type is custom.

properties.name: leaf_certificate
properties.description: (Optional) The contents of a PEM-formatted public TLS certificate. Only valid when type is custom.

properties.name: certificate_chain
properties.description: (Optional) The full PEM-formatted trust chain between the certificate authority's certificate and your domain's TLS certificate. Only valid when type is custom.

properties.name: domains
properties.description: (Optional) List of fully qualified domain names (FQDNs) for which the certificate will be issued. The domains must be managed using DigitalOcean's DNS. Only valid when type is lets_encrypt.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the database cluster.

properties.name: engine
properties.description: (Required) Database engine used by the cluster (ex. pg for PostreSQL, mysql for MySQL, or redis for Redis).

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) Database droplet size associated with the cluster (ex. db-s-1vcpu-1gb).

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) DigitalOcean region where the cluster will reside.

properties.name: node_count
properties.description: (Required) Number of nodes that will be included in the cluster.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Optional) Engine version used by the cluster (ex. 11 for PostgreSQL 11).

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A list of tag names to be applied to the database cluster.

properties.name: maintenance_window
properties.description: (Optional) Defines when the automatic maintenance should be performed for the database cluster.
maintenance_window supports the following:

properties.name: day
properties.description: (Required) The day of the week on which to apply maintenance updates.

properties.name: hour
properties.description: (Required) The hour in UTC at which maintenance updates will be applied in 24 hour format.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the domain

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: (Optional) The IP address of the domain. If specified, this IP is used to created an initial A record for the domain.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: image
properties.description: (Required) The Droplet image ID or slug.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The Droplet name.

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) The region to start in.

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) The unique slug that indentifies the type of Droplet. You can find a list of available slugs on DigitalOcean API documentation.

properties.name: backups
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean controlling if backups are made. Defaults to false.

properties.name: monitoring
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean controlling whether monitoring agent is installed. Defaults to false.

properties.name: ipv6
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean controlling if IPv6 is enabled. Defaults to false.

properties.name: private_networking
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean controlling if private networks are enabled. Defaults to false.

properties.name: ssh_keys
properties.description: (Optional) A list of SSH IDs or fingerprints to enable in the format [12345, 123456]. To retrieve this info, use a tool such as curl with the DigitalOcean API, to retrieve them.

properties.name: resize_disk
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean controlling whether to increase the disk size when resizing a Droplet. It defaults to true. When set to false, only the Droplet's RAM and CPU will be resized. Increasing a Droplet's disk size is a permanent change. Increasing only RAM and CPU is reversible.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A list of the tags to be applied to this Droplet.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: (Optional) - A string of the desired User Data for the Droplet.

properties.name: volume_ids
properties.description: (Optional) - A list of the IDs of each block storage volume to be attached to the Droplet.

NOTE: If you use volume_ids on a Droplet, Terraform will assume management over the full set volumes for the instance, and treat additional volumes as a drift. For this reason, volume_ids must not be mixed with external digitalocean_volume_attachment resources for a given instance.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A name for the Droplet snapshot.

properties.name: droplet_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Droplet from which the snapshot will be taken.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The Firewall name

properties.name: droplet_ids
properties.description: (Optional) - The list of the IDs of the Droplets assigned to the Firewall.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) - The names of the Tags assigned to the Firewall.

properties.name: inbound_rule
properties.description: (Optional) The inbound access rule block for the Firewall. The inbound_rule block is documented below.

properties.name: outbound_rule
properties.description: (Optional) The outbound access rule block for the Firewall. The outbound_rule block is documented below.
inbound_rule supports the following:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The type of traffic to be allowed. This may be one of "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

properties.name: port_range
properties.description: (Optional) The ports on which traffic will be allowed specified as a string containing a single port, a range (e.g. "8000-9000"), or "1-65535" to open all ports for a protocol. Required for when protocol is tcp or udp.

properties.name: source_addresses
properties.description: (Optional) An array of strings containing the IPv4 addresses, IPv6 addresses, IPv4 CIDRs, and/or IPv6 CIDRs from which the inbound traffic will be accepted.

properties.name: source_droplet_ids
properties.description: (Optional) An array containing the IDs of the Droplets from which the inbound traffic will be accepted.

properties.name: source_tags
properties.description: (Optional) An array containing the names of Tags corresponding to groups of Droplets from which the inbound traffic will be accepted.

properties.name: source_load_balancer_uids
properties.description: (Optional) An array containing the IDs of the Load Balancers from which the inbound traffic will be accepted.
outbound_rule supports the following:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The type of traffic to be allowed. This may be one of "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

properties.name: port_range
properties.description: (Optional) The ports on which traffic will be allowed specified as a string containing a single port, a range (e.g. "8000-9000"), or "1-65535" to open all ports for a protocol. Required for when protocol is tcp or udp.

properties.name: destination_addresses
properties.description: (Optional) An array of strings containing the IPv4 addresses, IPv6 addresses, IPv4 CIDRs, and/or IPv6 CIDRs to which the outbound traffic will be allowed.

properties.name: destination_droplet_ids
properties.description: (Optional) An array containing the IDs of the Droplets to which the outbound traffic will be allowed.

properties.name: destination_tags
properties.description: (Optional) An array containing the names of Tags corresponding to groups of Droplets to which the outbound traffic will be allowed. traffic.

properties.name: destination_load_balancer_uids
properties.description: (Optional) An array containing the IDs of the Load Balancers to which the outbound traffic will be allowed.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) The region that the Floating IP is reserved to.

properties.name: droplet_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of Droplet that the Floating IP will be assigned to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: (Required) The Floating IP to assign to the Droplet.

properties.name: droplet_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of Droplet that the Floating IP will be assigned to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The Load Balancer name

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) The region to start in

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: (Optional) The load balancing algorithm used to determine which backend Droplet will be selected by a client. It must be either round_robin or least_connections. The default value is round_robin.

properties.name: forwarding_rule
properties.description: (Required) A list of forwarding_rule to be assigned to the Load Balancer. The forwarding_rule block is documented below.

properties.name: healthcheck
properties.description: (Optional) A healthcheck block to be assigned to the Load Balancer. The healthcheck block is documented below. Only 1 healthcheck is allowed.

properties.name: sticky_sessions
properties.description: (Optional) A sticky_sessions block to be assigned to the Load Balancer. The sticky_sessions block is documented below. Only 1 sticky_sessions block is allowed.

properties.name: redirect_http_to_https
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean value indicating whether HTTP requests to the Load Balancer on port 80 will be redirected to HTTPS on port 443. Default value is false.

properties.name: enable_proxy_protocol
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean value indicating whether PROXY Protocol should be used to pass information from connecting client requests to the backend service. Default value is false.

properties.name: droplet_ids
properties.description: (Optional) - A list of the IDs of each droplet to be attached to the Load Balancer.

properties.name: droplet_tag
properties.description: (Optional) - The name of a Droplet tag corresponding to Droplets to be assigned to the Load Balancer.
forwarding_rule supports the following:

properties.name: entry_protocol
properties.description: (Required) The protocol used for traffic to the Load Balancer. The possible values are: http, https, http2 or tcp.

properties.name: entry_port
properties.description: (Required) An integer representing the port on which the Load Balancer instance will listen.

properties.name: target_protocol
properties.description: (Required) The protocol used for traffic from the Load Balancer to the backend Droplets. The possible values are: http, https, http2 or tcp.

properties.name: target_port
properties.description: (Required) An integer representing the port on the backend Droplets to which the Load Balancer will send traffic.

properties.name: certificate_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the TLS certificate to be used for SSL termination.

properties.name: tls_passthrough
properties.description: (Optional) A boolean value indicating whether SSL encrypted traffic will be passed through to the backend Droplets. The default value is false.
sticky_sessions supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) An attribute indicating how and if requests from a client will be persistently served by the same backend Droplet. The possible values are cookies or none. If not specified, the default value is none.

properties.name: cookie_name
properties.description: (Optional) The name to be used for the cookie sent to the client. This attribute is required when using cookies for the sticky sessions type.

properties.name: cookie_ttl_seconds
properties.description: (Optional) The number of seconds until the cookie set by the Load Balancer expires. This attribute is required when using cookies for the sticky sessions type.
healthcheck supports the following:

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Required) The protocol used for health checks sent to the backend Droplets. The possible values are http or tcp.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) An integer representing the port on the backend Droplets on which the health check will attempt a connection.

properties.name: path
properties.description: (Optional) The path on the backend Droplets to which the Load Balancer instance will send a request.

properties.name: check_interval_seconds
properties.description: (Optional) The number of seconds between between two consecutive health checks. If not specified, the default value is 10.

properties.name: response_timeout_seconds
properties.description: (Optional) The number of seconds the Load Balancer instance will wait for a response until marking a health check as failed. If not specified, the default value is 5.

properties.name: unhealthy_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) The number of times a health check must fail for a backend Droplet to be marked "unhealthy" and be removed from the pool. If not specified, the default value is 3.

properties.name: healthy_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) The number of times a health check must pass for a backend Droplet to be marked "healthy" and be re-added to the pool. If not specified, the default value is 5.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A name for the Kubernetes cluster.

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) The slug identifier for the region where the Kubernetes cluster will be created.

properties.name: version
properties.description: (Required) The slug identifier for the version of Kubernetes used for the cluster. Use doctl to find the available versions doctl kubernetes options versions.

properties.name: list description
name
properties.description: (Required) A name for the node pool.

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) The slug identifier for the type of Droplet to be used as workers in the node pool.

properties.name: node_count
properties.description: (Required) The number of Droplet instances in the node pool.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A list of tag names to be applied to the Kubernetes cluster.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A list of tag names to be applied to the Kubernetes cluster.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cluster_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the Kubernetes cluster to which the node pool is associated.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A name for the node pool.

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) The slug identifier for the type of Droplet to be used as workers in the node pool.

properties.name: node_count
properties.description: (Required) The number of Droplet instances in the node pool.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A list of tag names to be applied to the Kubernetes cluster.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Project

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) the description of the project

properties.name: purpose
properties.description: (Optional) the purpose of the project, (Default: "Web Application")

properties.name: environment
properties.description: (Optional) the environment of the project's resources. The possible values are: Development, Staging, Production)

properties.name: resources
properties.description: a list of uniform resource names (URNs) for the resources associated with the project
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of record. Must be one of A, AAAA, CAA, CNAME, MX, NS, TXT, or SRV.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: (Required) The domain to add the record to.

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The value of the record.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the record.

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Optional) The port of the record. Only valid when type is SRV. Must be between 1 and 65535.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) The priority of the record. Only valid when type is MX or SRV. Must be between 0 and 65535.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: (Optional) The weight of the record. Only valid when type is SRV. Must be between 0 and 65535.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: (Optional) The time to live for the record, in seconds. Must be at least 0.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: (Optional) The flags of the record. Only valid when type is CAA. Must be between 0 and 255.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: (Optional) The tag of the record. Only valid when type is CAA. Must be one of issue, issuewild, or iodef.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the bucket

properties.name: region
properties.description: The region where the bucket resides (Defaults to nyc3)

properties.name: acl
properties.description: Canned ACL applied on bucket creation (private or public-read)

properties.name: force_destroy
properties.description: Unless true, the bucket will only be destroyed if empty (Defaults to false)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the SSH key for identification

properties.name: public_key
properties.description: (Required) The public key. If this is a file, it can be read using the file interpolation function
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the tag
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Required) The region that the block storage volume will be created in.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A name for the block storage volume. Must be lowercase and be composed only of numbers, letters and "-", up to a limit of 64 characters.

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) The size of the block storage volume in GiB. If updated, can only be expanded.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A free-form text field up to a limit of 1024 bytes to describe a block storage volume.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of an existing volume snapshot from which the new volume will be created. If supplied, the region and size will be limitied on creation to that of the referenced snapshot

properties.name: initial_filesystem_type
properties.description: (Optional) Initial filesystem type (xfs or ext4) for the block storage volume.

properties.name: initial_filesystem_label
properties.description: (Optional) Initial filesystem label for the block storage volume.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: droplet_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the Droplet to attach the volume to.

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the Volume to be attached to the Droplet.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A name for the volume snapshot.

properties.name: volume_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the volume from which the volume snapshot originated.
